title: How does the immune system work? - Emma Bryce

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the immune system?

options.label: C
options.text: To protect the body against infection, illness, and disease

multiple-choice.question: Where do leukocytes originate in the body?

options.label: C
options.text: To latch onto invading cells and destroy them

options.label: C
options.text: To provide immunity to certain diseases

multiple-choice.question: What is an autoimmune disease?

options.label: B
options.text: A disease caused by a bacteria

options.label: C

options.label: C

title: The Bystander Effect: The science of empathy

multiple-choice.question: What is the bystander effect?

options.label: A
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are more likely to help someone in need than individuals who are alone.

options.label: B
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are less likely to help someone in need than individuals who are alone.

options.label: C
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are equally likely to help someone in need as individuals who are alone.

options.label: D
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are never likely to help someone in need.

multiple-choice.question: What is the average time it takes for someone to offer help when participants are in a group of 10?
What is the diffusion of responsibility?

options.label: A
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group feel that someone else will take care of the situation, and therefore, they don't need to take action.

options.label: B
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group feel that they need to take action, and therefore, they do it.

options.label: C
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are equally likely to take action as individuals who are alone.

options.label: D
options.text: A phenomenon where people in a group are never likely to take action.

multiple-choice.question: What is the average time it takes for someone to offer help when participants are alone?
What is the bystander effect's impact on emergency situations?

options.label: A
options.text: It can be a significant barrier to help being offered.

options.label: B
options.text: It can be a significant motivator for help being offered.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no impact on emergency situations.

options.label: D
options.text: It is always present in emergency situations.

multiple-choice.question: What is the importance of individual initiative and intuition in helping others?

options.label: A
options.text: It is not important in helping others.

options.label: B
options.text: It is only important in emergency situations.

options.label: C
options.text: It is important in helping others, especially when others are not present.

options.label: D
options.text: It is only important when others are present.

multiple-choice.question: What is the bystander effect's impact on social psychology?

options.label: A
options.text: It has no impact on social psychology.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a significant phenomenon that has implications for understanding human behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a minor phenomenon that has no implications for understanding human behavior.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a phenomenon that is only observed in emergency situations.

multiple-choice.question: What is the average time it takes for someone to offer help when participants are in a group of 5?
What is the bystander effect's impact on everyday interactions?

options.label: A
options.text: It can be a significant motivator for help being offered.

options.label: B
options.text: It can be a significant barrier to help being offered.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no impact on everyday interactions.

options.label: D
options.text: It is always present in everyday interactions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the bystander effect's impact on human behavior?

options.label: A
options.text: It has no impact on human behavior.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a significant phenomenon that has implications for understanding human behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a minor phenomenon that has no implications for understanding human behavior.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a phenomenon that is only observed in emergency situations.
